nautilus has been crippled too much

Nemo feels powerful and functional. I have no idea why Gnome thinks they've done good things to Nautilus. I install Nemo on every system.

description: very light and fast app. Much better then Nautilus
Great layout, and with the right gnome theme can become very familiar to devs migrating away from MacOS.
but don't know how to make it default
A powerful file manager in every sense

I've been using this for a few years now, it has better viewing options and more accessible tools than Nautilus. 
I can't say why some say it crashes, I've used it since Ubuntu 16.04, or whenever it was they over simplified Nautilus.
summary: By far the best File Explorer for ubuntu

description: The files works fine for the most part. I only ran into issues with crashing when i used QT apps to navigate the file explorer.

Explicitly, I wanted to have directories be expandable and collapsable.
More to this, ctrl+right-arrow allow to expand.

Just having tabs (no menu bar and no toolbar) is enough for me.
summary: Love it! More customizable than Thunar

description: Why isn't THIS the default file manager for Ubuntu?

It used to work okay, so I thought, then I noticed that my RAM was being used up a lot. I looked and saw that Nemo was using 5 GB of RAM despite it being just one window open sitting there doing nothing. I now use Caja instead.
summary: It consumes massive amounts of RAM

description: Every time I set up a new machine, the first thing I do is change from Nautilus to Nemo. That's a huge headache on Ubuntu 19.04+, though.
summary: I love that you can copy/paste the path

description: Nemo includes several quality-of-life functions missing in Nautilus such as reordering of search results, files renaming on long double click, and a quickly-accessible icon to create new folders. Productivity man.
summary: Runs perfectly on 18.04. Lots of functionality missing in Nautilus

description: it is good app
best file manager!

rename not working on Ubuntu 20.04.

The app provides some very useful and easy to use functionality and some that most other filemangers don't have, such as creation date/time.
summary: Good app, would like to give 5 stars but..

description: Need to search files by date range with additional filter like path and file type. Was only able to search by name. Lacks basic functionality essential to any basic file browser.
Nothing to complain, has many features that I use daily now, I also really like the interface/layout
summary: Has more features than other and I really like it

description: One of the best file folder explorer out there.

So much better than default file browser. Still no folder size in kb though (who the hell cares about number of items? And since when did number of items equal size??). But this seems like rocket science in Linux, so better not ask.
Great file manager. And could be 2 pane!

Good work, people. Though it suffers from the same not-even-trying Linux product naming convention of a single literal word, thereby confusing it with the inferior "Files" included in Ubuntu, this Files is superior, the offering that finally breaks through the obstacles of approximating Microsoft Windows' List View--here called Compact View; just fine--and goes two steps further with compact view thumbnails and the ability to switch them off if you like. Thank you for this! Ubuntu people--sign them up!
summary: By now should be standard file manager

description: Good replacer for Ubuntu file manager. Customizable and two pane enabled option

Bulk Renaming Not working, Open in Terminal Icon not working, Files are loading slow and has no settings for view folder ( wanted only to show folder name but it shows no. of items this is I don't want )
Extremely slow to the point of unusability. Do not use on ubuntu 20.10
I got bungie linux 20.20 and when I open a jpg often it opens just a thubnail size of it and stays there. ( laptop lenovo i5 , 6300u 12 gb ram )

Better than Nautilus, I can edit/copy path.
But very slow on Ubuntu 20.04, it was fast on 18.04.
The animation is laggy on properties when opening Permission tab. It is fast in previous version of ubuntu.

It has it all and forget about nautilus, it better organizes the sizes of the icons, it remembers the sizes of the folders and the files, it organizes by MIME file types, the search for documents is extremely fast, you get directly to the file you write. highly configurable. double view + tabs for each view, good organization of the elements. 
==Español==
Lo tiene todo y olvidate de nautilus, organiza mejor los tamaños de los iconos, recuerda los tamaños de las carpeta y los archivos, organiza por tipos de archivos MIME, la búsqueda de documentos es en extremo rápida, llegas directamente al archivo que escribes. altamente configurable. doble vista+pestañas por cada vista, buena organización de los elementos. Miniaturas, etc... Lo tiene todo.
summary: Lo mejor que hay, aun mejor que Nautilus

description: Forget Nautilus it's garbage. These are the managers you want!
summary: NEMO and Dolphin are the best!

description: Unlike Nautilus, it has Date Created column in table view, has list view.
how tomake it default on
Don't know about this app
The left-click fails to register after a right-click on Gnome, Debian 11

It works, I use it at home and at school, but for some reason I've been unable to connect to my Raspberry Pi to view the files on it. When ever I enter what should be a valid address, the text I type goes red and nothing happens.
summary: I can't figure out how to connect to file servers

description:
Although looking polished and elegant, the app lacks two my favorite features:
1. Compact View of files and folders is not available at all and can't be installed. Eventually had to download Thunar file manager.
2. Not possible to open a folder as root by right-clicking on an empty space (I used to utilize this option very often in Linux Mint Xfce). But this probably is a feature of Ubuntu itself rather than particularly this file manager.
Feature-wise it's better than nautilus, but the appearance needs rework. Switched back to nautilus because I like the pretty GUI more than the features I want that are present in nemo.

I would expect to be able to change individual file icons in the sidebar. Plus adding new folders to the My computer section is needlessly complex, having to first create a bookmark before dragging into it. Until this is fixed i cannot recommend using nemo if you are a organized individual
Fantastic file manager. First app I install on any distro that doesn't come with it and it is the only file manager I like to use.
Great app, my favorite file manager for Gnome and Cinnamon DE
Should be default in Ubuntu ... sry Ubuntu Team :(
Installed this in hopes of getting my mp4 and other videos to show actual thumbnails, but it does not. Otherwise it is an okay file manager.
Nemo is a file manager balance between beautiful UI and full packed features.
summary: Balance between beautiful UI and features

description: This is the app I use to navigate my repertories . You can open a folder as root in one simple right-click , that is my main argument

Nemo file manager is listed as "file" the same way Nautilus is listed as file , but it is a much better file manager. It does not automatically lock external drives the way Dolphin and Thunar do and itś loaded with practical options-similar to what you find in a Windows file manager-geared to working in Linux. Itś stable and easy to manage and use.
summary: Very good and easy to use. Not quirky like other file managers

description: This is the best file manager in the world of Linux.
one of the best file managers

My choice for Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS.
(It has Nautilus for default. Very bad choice.)

Files (is Nemo) has everything, except:
1. It can't rename many files at once.
2. If hidden files view isn't checked it doesn't show how many hidden files are.

Better than Thunar, but Thunar can rename many files at once and it looks nicer.

This is Nemo file manager.
Install it and make it dafault, just type on Terminal:
xdg-mime default nemo.desktop inode/directory application/x-gnome-saved-search
gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.background show-desktop-icons false
gsettings set org.nemo.desktop show-desktop-icons true

To go back to Nautilus as default:
xdg-mime default nautilus.desktop inode/directory application/x-gnome-saved-search
gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.background show-desktop-icons true

Do not remove-delete Nautilus.
Even with Nemo as default Nautilus the system uses it in some cases.
summary: Make it default for Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS

description:
I use Nautilus - now called Files, because it has add ones for shrinking photographs and ADMINISTRATIVE CONTROL over directories, files and functions - and other things.

I use Thunar - I forget why - because it's pretty good at some things.

And I use Nemo - because as a file manager, it's a lot more sophisticated.

Nemo is sort of more complete.

But I'd be lost without all three of them - doing what I do... they are all different and necessary and all good.
summary: There are different properties and functions in all the file managers

description: All the options to present large numbers of files i was missing in the standard file manager. Also has some useful plugins.
summary: the better alternative to the standard file manager

description: I have a Problem after installing with Trash Stuck in active loop top of page Ubuntu 22.04 . I found if I open the old original file manager ( i believe Nautilus)  the loop activity is ended .. must be a conflict on some of the item in both ??  Not sure the real fix is maybe someone knows ?
summary: Problem with Trash Stuck in active loop top of page Ubuntu 22.04

description: Runecrush376 Approves this thingy. Great app to browse yer files. 10 ouutta 10
Does everything you need it to do; no more and no less. Nice, clean look too. Gottat love it!
summary: Good and dependable! Best I've used in 20+ years!

description:
Etwas mehr an Zubehör und Einstellmöglichkeiten als vergleichbare, grafische Filemanger unter Linux (z.B.Nautilus oder Dolphin). Passt sich nahtlos eigener Systemthemes an. 

Wer von MS Windows kommt, wird sich hier schnell zurechtfinden. Es können neue Dateiansichten in zusätzlichen Registerkarten geöffnet werden und das Öffnen von Verzeichnissen als "Systemadministrator" funktioniert auf Rechtsklick aus dem Kontextmenü.

Vorsicht: Wer auch weiter mit MS Windows zu tun hat, wird das Programm definitiv vermissen! Noch ein Tipp: Die Vorschau von Bilddateien ist per default etwas zu niedrig eingestellt, um Fotos moderner Kameras als "thumbnail" anzuzeigen. Dies kann aber über die "Programmeinstellungen" schnell geändert werden.
Keine Baumverzeichnisstruktur und man kann Ordner nicht umbenennen. Was fürn Müll.

Als " Blutiger UBUNTU-Anfänger " - kann ich mich nur den Worten meines Vorrezendenten - RB anschließen.
Mein Fazit: Das einzige was hier MÜLL ist - 
ist Deine Rezension , Taggart

Ich bin "zufällig" auf diesen Deteimanager gekommen und empfinde die Nutzung als eine enorme Erleichterung gegenüber dem Ubuntu Standrad. Da ich unter Linux noch nicht ganz firm bin, muss ich noch herausfinden, wie ich ihn als Standard einstellen kann. Ich kann ihn nur empfehlen. In jedem Fall für Umsteiger ausprobieren. Deinstallieren kann man immer, falls es nicht das passende Werkzeug ist:-)
summary: Ein MUSS für Umsteiger von Windows auf Linux

description: Was ist denn bitte an Nautilus verkehrt. Macht doch alles was es soll. UND mit dconf-editor laesst sich alles anpassen. Das Design ist deutlich besser als Nemo, aber da jeder eben seine Prioritaeten.
Dieser Dateimanager ist bestimmt besser als der von Windows *grins*

Wenn man vergleicht, wie flüssig man mit dem Mac Finder rundum und speziell mit Multimedia arbeiten kann, sind leider alle Dateimanager eine unbenutzbare Katastrophe.
Allerlei Grundfunktionen mögen zwar gelöst sein, aber es fehlen Usability und moderne Features an allen Ecken und Enden, die man nach 25 Jahren wirklich erwarten könnte.
Die die Unmotiviertheit, wie da ein Dutzend Projekte um dasselbe Ziel bzw. Vorbild herumeiern, ohne daß ihm auch nur EINES näherkommt, ist leider lächerlich und symptomatisch für die vorherrschende OSS-Einstellung von Vielfalt, anstatt daß endlich einmal Kapazitäten bei neuralgischen Aufgabenstellungen gebündelt und zu einem gemeinsamen Ziel, das die Anforderungen wirklich umfassend löst, entwickelt werden.
...denn das kann Nautilus nicht - oder zumindest habe ich diese Fähigkeit noch nie gefunden. Nemo kann das. Danke.
much better than the default
Übersichtlicher und schöner Dateimaneger, wesentlich besser als NAutilus

Ich bin der gleichen Meinung wie RB. Generell finde ich es nicht gut, dass einige Dateimanager unter Linux nur noch "Dateien" heissen. Das ist nicht benutzerfreundlich. Wenn man mehrere nebeneinander benützt, vor allem wenn sie ähnlich aussehen, weiss man manchmal nicht, mit welchem man es gerade zu tun hat.
Gefällt mir sogar besser als Dolphin.
+ Die Baumdarstellung auf der linken Seite
Me permite ver en modo árbol además de muchas otras opciones, posee una configuración sencilla
me sirvio para usar el explorador en modo root
La función de cambiar nombre a un archivo no sirve.
Es sin duda, el mejor administrador de ficheros. He probado Thunar y PcmanFc y Nemo ha superado, ampliamente, mis expectativas.
Sencilla para lo que tiene que hacer
no me deja instalar nada
Secilla y tiene lo necesario.

No maneja bien los permisos si se corre en el escritorio KDE. No permite el acceso a unidades de red, ni siquiera estando montadas 

Igualmente, es mi segunda opción en comparación con otros gestores de archivos.
su doble ventana se ha convertido en la principal herramienta de uso diario
puissant possibilité de root
Unfortunatly it Seems not to be very compatible with Ubuntu19.10
summary: Nice but crash at each drag&drop operation

description: An app with more options of configuration than nautilus. The only negative thing is that the look is not as good as nautilus (not very gnome look)
stable sous mobian ... efficace et pratique ...

Bien qu'étant un Fork de Nautilus, Nemo est plus puissant dans les recherches de fichiers et la gestion directe (possibilité d'épingler fichiers et dossiers ; gestion des favoris simplifiés ; connexions réseau).
Il lui manque simplement une meilleure intégration aux systèmes autres que Cinnamon (thèmes ; définition par défaut) pour la 5è étoile !
Bien meilleur que Nautilus
Au moins ça, ça ressemble à un véritable explorateur de fichier...
summary: Au moins ça, ça ressemble à un véritable explorateur de fichier..

description: bien meilleure que Nautilus !
Fait bien mieux le job que nautilus.

Un très bon remplaçant de Nautilus (dont les versions récentes sont vraiment pourries) mais il n'est pas aussi bien que Caja, notamment parce qu'il n'affiche qu'un chemin lors dans le mode bi-fenêtre, ce qui n'est vraiment pas pratique (par exemple, cela complique la copie et le déplacement). A part ce défaut, il est très proche de Caja (et, donc, de Nautilus 3.4, qui était le meilleur gestionnaire de fichiers de son époque) et constitue un bon choix.
summary: Très bien mais pas le meilleur

description: На первых порах сойдёт, пока не найдёшь что-то более функциональное типа дельфина.

Самый удобный файловый менеджер, среди не только Linux, но и всех ОС вообще. Гибкая настройка, стабильная работа (по крайней мере у меня).
F3 я от тебя не откажусь! ;)
хорошее приложение
лучший из лучших.. нужно поумолчанию включить в дистрибутив Ubuntu
Nautilus + Caja, но в одном приложении
Лучший файловый менеджер для настольных операционных систем с ядром Linux
явно лучше Explorer из Windows
Очень удобный и практичный файловый менеджер

Приятно выглядит как в Gnome, так и Kde. Неплохо совмещает приятный внешний вид и функционал. Есть двухпанельный режим. Единственный из популярных фм, который позволяет задать отдельный вид и сортировку для каждой папки.
Файловый менеджер.

Хорошая проггамма но увидел одну большую проблемму.
Когда изменил имя файлов и поставил вначале 2 точки то файлы исчезли. Их просто нет не в корзине и нигде. Повторно сделал эксперимент с другими файлами и тот же результат.
Прошу исправить.
Спасибо.
summary: Проблемма при переименовании с точками в начале

description: Работает стабильно в любых оболочках. Спасибо разработчикам.

Прекрасный файловый менеджер. В нем отлично работает подключение к серверам по FTP, стабильно держит соединение. Трудности бывают только при передаче большого количества мелких файлов. Удобная навигация по папкам, особенно в режиме иерархического списка.
но вот вылетает время от времени
比NATLES不知道高到哪去了
summary: 赞比NATLES不知道高到哪去了
